description.narrative: B-READY has now been tested in the Philippines (B.Ready A-05666), and has initial funding to be piloted in Sudan. To make the jump from ‘pilot’ to ‘preparing for scale’ B-READY needs to: 1. Evidence the current B-READY Model for iterative improvement, advocacy and impact: The project will cover 2 new locations in the Philippines, and continue in its current operational area to generate evidence including a Randomized Control Trial, to create iterative improvement, advocacy materials and build B-READY for adoption. 2. Codification of the B-READY Philippines and Global Scale Model includes mapping similar initiatives elsewhere for collaboration or learning, considering ‘fertile’ areas for scale up (financing, locations, actors, policy routes), choosing astrategic scale up trajectorybased on lessons learned, and then a collaborative codification process linking the Philippines National Model, with a Global ScaleModel and ‘testing’ these with new funders and implementers to ensure greatest impact, cost-efficiency and ethical risk management. 3. Building B-READY for Sustainability at Scale by practically testing local and global sustainability pathways through government uptake (Philippines), private sector finance business models, global FbF, and pre-emptive financial tools/mechanisms currently under-discussion. Furthermore, there will be global advocacy, influencing and knowledge sharing, having B-READY and its Scale Model featured in many appropriate forums, exposure visits, webinar presentations, socialisation workshops, targeted policy papers, and discussions with strategic actors to build new partners for adoption. Plan International Netherlands builds on vast experience implementingDRR and CVA programming globally and in the Philippines, focusing on child’s rights and gender equality. Plan Philippines will oversee the implementation of the project in Oras, support the evidencing and codification of B-READY, and contribute to local and global learning and advocacy.

participating-org.narrative: Plan Nederland, founded in 1975, is a member of the worldwide umbrella organization Plan International. Plan Nederland aims at sustainable poverty reduction and lasting improvements in the living condition of children. The organization pays special attention to equal rights and opportunities for girls and advocates for the rights of children and better compliance with the Convention on the Rights of the Child. Plan carries out child-centered community projects in 50 countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America. By listening to children and working together them, advocating for their rights, and enabling them and their families and communities to meet basic needs, Plan works towards concrete and sustainable improvements in the lives of children.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
